definition: to work for a trial period/worker on probation
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
erhua variant of 試手|试手[shi4 shou3]

sentences.english: The little boy tried his hand at chess.
sentences.chinese: 那小男孩在棋局上试手。

definition: lit. seeing others go hunting, one is excited by memories of the thrill of the hunt (idiom)/fig. seeing others do what one loves to do, one is inspired to try it again
see 小試牛刀|小试牛刀[xiao3 shi4 niu2 dao1]
to compare notes/to learn from one another/to swap pointers
audition/dress rehearsal/preview (of a theatrical performance)/dummy run
lit. to toss a stone to find out what's ahead (idiom)/fig. to test the waters
empty-handed/unarmed/(painting, embroidery etc) without following a model/(abbr. for 空手道[kong1 shou3 dao4]) karate
variant of 鏈|链[lian4], chain/variant of 煉|炼[lian4]
